channel.title: How to make an Emote last untill you do resetanim();?
channel.description: How can you make it so that you will continue doing an emote untill you actully do 'resetAnimation();' ? I mostly do the emote once, then wait, and then get an item

item.title: How to make an Emote last untill you do resetanim();?
item.dc:creator: @AD_LVL_7 AD LVL 7
item.description:
@AD_LVL_7 wrote:

public void startAnimation(int animIdx){ animationRequest = animIdx; animationWaitCycles = 0;}
this is my startanim void

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:8, topic:98292”]No wonder… your setAnimation void is messed, resetAnimation is alright, just replace the setAnimation void with this public void setAnimation(int i) { //pEmote = i; //updateRequired = true; //appearanceUpdateRequired = true; startAnimation(i); }[/quote]
the slash statements (’//’) are actully making it somekind of info, so it’s the same

Read full topic
item.source: How to make an Emote last untill you do resetanim();?

item.title: How to make an Emote last untill you do resetanim();?
item.dc:creator: @MisterZ MisterZ
item.description:
@MisterZ wrote:

NO! it’s not exactly the same because it’s formatted differently… That’s easily mistaken. But it is the same method.

@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

No wonder… your setAnimation void is messed, resetAnimation is alright, just replace the setAnimation void with this public void setAnimation(int i) { //pEmote = i; //updateRequired = true; //appearanceUpdateRequired = true; startAnimation(i); }

item.title: How to make an Emote last untill you do resetanim();?
item.dc:creator: @AD_LVL_7 AD LVL 7
item.description:
@AD_LVL_7 wrote:

public void setAnimation(int i) {startAnimation(i);} public void resetAnimation() { pEmote = playerSE; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

Maybe It’s the same, and it could have to do something with player.java
